title: Drawing, 1873
medium:
Recto: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on tan wove paper
Verso: Graphite
markings: Recto: Stamped in ink, lower right corner: oval, Cooper-Union
signed: Signed and dated in graphite, lower left: T Moran / 1873
description:
Recto: View of the Grand Canyon from the rim of Powell's Plateau, one of the most scenic vistas of the Grand Canyon and Colorado River, named after the explorer and geologist John Wesley Powell, leader of the Colorado River Expedition.
Verso: Barely decipherable landscape (?) in ruled graphite border.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1873.
1873. Recto: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on tan wove paper
Verso: Graphite. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-26.
